thread.title: Stocks choppy as Fed looms; Walmart wage hike blowback; $20 oil?
thread.title_full: Stocks choppy as Fed looms; Walmart wage hike blowback; $20 oil?

title: Stocks choppy as Fed looms; Walmart wage hike blowback; $20 oil?
text:
Content preferences Done 
It looks as if more volatility is in store for stocks ( ^GSPC ) as Wall Street wraps up a holiday shortened week that has been punctuated by lots of fits and starts every session. 
Yahoo Finance Senior Columnist Michael Santoli says "choppy" is clearly the operative word lately. 
"The market's own dynamics have been dictating the day to day activity," he notes. "We've been trapped in this new lower range, it's been extremely volatile in that range, and for about two weeks now we really haven't resolved anything." 
One piece of economic data might impact trading today-- The Labor Department reporting wholesale inflation was flat last month, but taking out food and energy it jumped a more than expected 0.3%. 
Restoration Hardware tops estimates 
Here are some of the stocks the Yahoo Finance team will be watching for you today. 
Restoration Hardware Holdings ( RH ) The luxury home products retailer is reporting better than expected profit and revenue in the second quarter. Restoration Hardware says net revenues jumped 17%, helped by an increase of in-store sales. And the company says it is launching two new businesses called RH Modern and RH Teen over the next three months. 
Pfizer ( PFE ) A British judge is rejecting the pharmaceutical company's patent protection lawsuit involving its anxiety and epilepsy treatment, Lyrica. Pfizer had argued that a secondary patent for Lyrica as a pain treatment means other drugmakers shouldn't be allowed to sell a generic version. But the judge disagreed...freeing up rivals Allergan ( AGN ) and Mylan ( MYL ), which already make a generic form of Lyrica. 
ZS Pharma ( ZSPH ) Swiss pharmaceutical firm Actelion confirms it is in talks to buy the California-based company that is awaiting FDA approval for its treatment of elevated levels of potassium in the blood. Rumors of a possible takeover sent ZS Pharma shares up more than 28% yesterday. 
Lululemon Athletica ( LULU ) After the stock fell more than 16% yesterday on the athletic apparel maker's earnings report, it's getting some analyst love. RW Baird is upgrading shares to outperform from neutral, citing what it calls a "compelling" valuation. 
Marvell Technology Group ( MRVL ) The semiconductor company says in a regulatory filing it's investigating possible accounting irregularities. 
Goldman: $20 oil possible 
Oil ( OIL ) has been hovering the $40 a barrel range for months now, putting producers in a bind. Now Goldman Sachs ( GS ) is slashing its oil price forecasts, even claiming crude could crash to $20 a barrel. 
More trouble in the land of bitcoin. Japanese prosecutors have charged Mount Gox founder Mark Karpeles with embezzlement, after 850,000 bitcoins went missing at his exchange. Karpeles claims the allegations are false.Walmart ( WMT ) won praise for raising wages, but who’s footing the bill? Bloomberg reports the world’s largest retailer is squeezing its suppliers with higher fees, which the suppliers allege are being used to pay for part of those aforementioned wage hikes. 
More from Yahoo Finance
